title: Autobiography of Mrs. Fletcher.
author: Fletcher
snippet: Grace remained in Yorkshire all the following winter, cheering by the sweetness of her engaging manners the kind old friends whose quiet and unvaried hours formed a striking contrast with the gaiety and animation of an Edinburgh winter. During some weeks of this winter she had the happiness to be the guest of Mrs. Millar (who then resided at the village of Fulford, near York), and certainly no-one out of her own family ever obtained so strong an influence over her mind and affections. This waa.
